newsitem.title: NAMIBIA: NAMIBIA STOCKS WEEK - SOUTHERN LIFE SHARES LIVELY.
newsitem.headline: NAMIBIA STOCKS WEEK - SOUTHERN LIFE SHARES LIVELY.

text.p: dominated trade in the Namibian Stock Exchange (NSE)
last week when 151,200 shares worth about N$6.2 million
exchanged hands during the four days of trade, the bourse's
Total equity turnover amounted to N$7.6 million in value on
a total volume of 625,700 shares, they added.
Other movers on NSE had been Nictus which surged on
Friday with 380,000 shares traded in range of N$1.15 to N$1.20
and Namibia Breweries which held its current high
The officials said the NSE local index ended the week up at
166.88, compared to the previous week's close of 165.58.
But the NSE overall index had finished slightly down at
247.43, compared to the previous week's close of 248.17.
The bourse had been closed on Monday, May 26, for a holiday.
